page.title: 05THE COMMUNITY BUS
page.content: The Community Bus is a 'free' bus that runs every Thursday. It takes people from Mottram St. Andrew and Newton to Wilmslow and Alderley Edge. It leaves Mottram at 10.30 am and returns from Alderley Edge in the early afternoon. The 'free' bus is paid for by the Wright's Trust using money left in a will. On 11th July, 1985 Gail Rowbotham and Rosemarie Owen carried out a survey of people using the bus. Ten people got on at Mottram and three people and one baby got on at Newton. Four people got off at Wilmslow and the rest got off at Alderley Edge. All the people went shopping. Everybody except one used the bus nearly every week. Over half of the people did not have the use of a car so the bus was very important to them. by Gail Rowbotham and Rosemarie Owen.
